title: Study Timetable Planner
goal: Create effective study timetables for students preparing for exams.
prompt: Create a study time table to prepare for {subject} exam. Include study hours, allot time for each subject based on priority, and proper breaks.

responses.gemini-2.5:
A **well-structured and realistic daily timetable** is crucial for your NEET preparation. This sample schedule is designed for **10-12 hours of focused study** per day, prioritizing **Biology** (highest weightage) and dedicating ample time to **Physics and Chemistry**, along with proper breaks and sleep.

Remember to **customize** this based on your own strong/weak subjects, coaching/school timings, and peak productivity hours.

---

## ðŸ“… Daily NEET Study Timetable (Sample)

| Time Slot | Duration | Activity | Focus / Subject Priority |
| :---: | :---: | :--- | :--- |
| **5:30 AM** | 30 min | Wake up, Freshen up | Start Fresh |
| **6:00 AM â€“ 8:30 AM** | 2.5 hrs | Biology (Theory/NCERT) | High Priority â€“ NCERT reading and diagrams |
| **8:30 â€“ 9:00 AM** | 30 min | Breakfast / Walk | Break |
| **9:00 â€“ 11:30 AM** | 2.5 hrs | Physics (Concepts & Numericals) | Conceptual + Problem solving |
| **11:30 â€“ 12:00 PM** | 30 min | Short Break | Relax, no screens |
| **12:00 â€“ 2:00 PM** | 2 hrs | Chemistry (Organic/Inorganic) | Memorization & reactions |
| **2:00 â€“ 3:00 PM** | 1 hr | Lunch + Power Nap | Recharge |
| **3:00 â€“ 5:00 PM** | 2 hrs | Practice: MCQs/PYQs | Biology topics practiced |
| **5:00 â€“ 5:30 PM** | 30 min | Break | Walk/Relax |
| **5:30 â€“ 7:30 PM** | 2 hrs | Chemistry (Physical Practice) | Numerical solving |
| **7:30 â€“ 8:30 PM** | 1 hr | Dinner + Relax | Refresh |
| **8:30 â€“ 10:30 PM** | 2 hrs | Revision + Notes | Revise, plan next day |
| **10:30 PM** | â€” | Sleep | 7 hrs minimum |

---

### Key Principles for Success
1. **Biology:** 50% focus (4-5 hrs/day) â€“ NCERT mastery.
2. **Physics:** 25-30% (3-4 hrs/day) â€“ Concepts + numericals.
3. **Chemistry:** 25-30% (3-4 hrs/day) â€“ Theory + reactions.
4. **Breaks:** Follow Pomodoro (50/10 rule).
5. **Sunday:** Full mock test + weak area revision.

> ðŸ’¡ The best timetable is one you can stick to consistently.

responses.claude-3:
# NEET Exam Preparation Study Timetable

## Daily Schedule (8-9 Hours of Focused Study)

### Morning Session: 6:00 AM - 12:00 PM

| Time | Subject | Duration | Focus |
|------|---------|----------|-------|
| 6:00 - 6:30 AM | Revision & Warm-up | 30 mins | Previous day's topics |
| 6:30 - 8:00 AM | Biology (Botany) | 90 mins | High Priority |
| 8:00 - 8:15 AM | Break | 15 mins | Snack/Stretch |
| 8:15 - 9:45 AM | Chemistry (Organic) | 90 mins | Conceptual Focus |
| 9:45 - 10:00 AM | Break | 15 mins | Refresh |
| 10:00 - 11:30 AM | Physics | 90 mins | Problem Solving |
| 11:30 - 12:00 PM | Quick Review | 30 mins | Morning Recap |

---

### Afternoon Session: 12:00 PM - 1:30 PM
| Time | Activity | Duration |
|------|----------|----------|
| 12:00 - 1:30 PM | Lunch & Rest | 90 mins |

---

### Evening Session: 1:30 PM - 6:00 PM
| Time | Subject | Duration | Focus |
|------|---------|----------|-------|
| 1:30 - 3:00 PM | Biology (Zoology) | 90 mins | Detailed Concepts |
| 3:00 - 3:15 PM | Break | 15 mins | Rest |
| 3:15 - 4:45 PM | Chemistry (Physical/Inorganic) | 90 mins | Calculations |
| 4:45 - 5:00 PM | Break | 15 mins | Refresh |
| 5:00 - 6:00 PM | Practice/Mock Tests | 60 mins | Application |

---

### Night Session: 6:00 PM - 7:30 PM
| Time | Activity | Duration | Focus |
|------|----------|----------|-------|
| 6:00 - 7:00 PM | Dinner & Recreation | 60 mins | Relax |
| 7:00 - 7:30 PM | Daily Revision | 30 mins | Consolidate |

---

### Weekly Plan
| Priority | Subject | Hours/Day |
|-----------|----------|------------|
| High | Biology | 3.5 hrs |
| Medium | Chemistry | 2.5 hrs |
| Medium | Physics | 1.5 hrs |
| Daily | Practice | 1 hr |

---

**Saturday:** Weekly Revision + Problem Solving (6-8 hrs)

**Sunday:** Mock Test + Analysis (3-4 hrs) + Rest

---

**Study Tips:** Active learning, spaced revision, NCERT focus, daily MCQs (200-300), weekly mocks, 7-8 hrs sleep, hydration.

**Reminder:** Consistency > intensity. Quality study with breaks leads to long-term retention.
